member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.SourceCollection
member.summary: A collection of sources (or physical connectors) on an audio or video device. This is used by the class to provide a list of available sources on the currently selected audio and video devices. This class cannot be created directly. This class assumes there is only 1 video and 1 audio crossbar and all input pins route to a single output pin on each crossbar.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.SourceCollection.#ctor(DShowNET.ICaptureGraphBuilder2,DShowNET.IBaseFilter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize collection with sources from graph.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.SourceCollection.addFromGraph(DShowNET.ICaptureGraphBuilder2,DShowNET.IBaseFilter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Populate the collection from a filter graph.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.SourceCollection.findCrossbars(DShowNET.ICaptureGraphBuilder2,DShowNET.IBaseFilter)
member.summary: Retrieve a list of crossbar filters in the graph. Most hardware devices should have a maximum of 2 crossbars, one for video and another for audio.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.SourceCollection.findCrossbarSources(DShowNET.ICaptureGraphBuilder2,DShowNET.IAMCrossbar,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Populate the internal InnerList with sources/physical connectors found on the crossbars. Each instance of this class is limited to video only or audio only sources ( specified by the isVideoDevice parameter on the constructor) so we check each source before adding it to the list.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.SourceCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the source at the specified index.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.SourceCollection.CurrentSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the source/physical connector currently in use. This is marked internal so that the Capture class can control how and when the source is changed.

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.Source
member.summary: Represents a physical connector or source on an audio/video device.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Source.ToString
member.summary: Obtains the String representation of this instance.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Source.Name
member.summary: The name of the source. Read-only.

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.DeviceInUseException
member.summary: Exception thrown when the device cannot be rendered or started.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.DeviceInUseException.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance with the specified HRESULT

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.AudioCapabilities
member.summary: Capabilities of the audio device such as min/max sampling rate and number of channels available.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.AudioCapabilities.ChannelsGranularity
member.summary: Granularity of the channels. For example, channels 2 through 4, in steps of 2.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.AudioCapabilities.MinimumSampleSize
member.summary: Minimum number of bits per sample.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.AudioCapabilities.MaximumSampleSize
member.summary: Maximum number of bits per sample.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.AudioCapabilities.SampleSizeGranularity
member.summary: Granularity of the bits per sample. For example, 8 bits per sample through 32 bits per sample, in steps of 8.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.AudioCapabilities.SamplingRateGranularity
member.summary: Granularity of the frequency. For example, 11025 Hz to 44100 Hz, in steps of 11025 Hz.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.AudioCapabilities.#ctor(DShowNET.IAMStreamConfig)
member.summary: Retrieve capabilities of an audio device

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.DirectShowPropertyPage
member.summary: Property pages for a DirectShow filter (e.g. hardware device). These property pages do not support persisting their settings.

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.PropertyPage
member.summary: A base class for representing property pages exposed by filters.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.PropertyPage.Name
member.summary: Name of property page. This name may not be unique

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.PropertyPage.SupportsPersisting
member.summary: Does this property page support saving and loading the user's choices.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.PropertyPage.Show(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Show the property page. Some property pages cannot be displayed while previewing and/or capturing. This method will block until the property page is closed by the user.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.PropertyPage.State
member.summary: Get or set the state of the property page. This is used to save and restore the user's choices without redisplaying the property page.
member.remarks:
After showing this property page, read and store the value of this property. At a later time, the user's choices can be reloaded by setting this property with the value stored earlier. Note that some property pages, after setting this property, will not reflect the new state. However, the filter will use the new settings.
When reading this property, copy the entire array at once then manipulate your local copy (e..g byte[] myState = propertyPage.State). When setting this property set the entire array at once (e.g. propertyPage = myState).
Not all property pages support saving/loading state. Check the property to determine if this property page supports it.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.DirectShowPropertyPage.Show(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Show the property page. Some property pages cannot be displayed while previewing and/or capturing.

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.Filter
member.summary: Represents a DirectShow filter (e.g. video capture device, compression codec).

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.Filter.MonikerString
member.summary: Unique string referencing this filter. This string can be used to recreate this filter.

member.summary: Create a new filter from its moniker string.

member.summary: Retrieve the a moniker's display name (i.e. it's unique string)

member.summary: Retrieve the human-readable name of the filter

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Filter.getName(System.String)
member.summary: Get a moniker's human-readable name based on a moniker string.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Filter.getAnyMoniker
member.summary:
This method gets a UCOMIMoniker object.
HACK: The only way to create a UCOMIMoniker from a moniker string is to use UCOMIMoniker.ParseDisplayName(). So I need ANY UCOMIMoniker object so that I can call ParseDisplayName(). Does anyone have a better solution?
This assumes there is at least one video compressor filter installed on the system.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Filter.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type.

member.summary: Collection of available video capture devices.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.Filters.AudioInputDevices
member.summary: Collection of available audio capture devices.

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.FilterCollection
member.summary: A collection of Filter objects (DirectShow filters). This is used by the class to provide lists of capture devices and compression filters. This class cannot be created directly.

member.summary: Populate the collection with a list of filters from a particular category.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.DxUtils.getMediaSubType(DShowNET.IAMStreamConfig)
member.summary: Get the video type for the specified pin interface

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.DxUtils.setMediaSubType(DShowNET.IAMStreamConfig,DirectX.Capture.DxUtils.ColorSpaceEnum)
member.summary: Set video type for the specified pin interface

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.DxUtils.setMediaSubType(DShowNET.IAMStreamConfig,System.Guid)
member.summary: Set video type for the specified pin interface

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.DxUtils.FindMediaData(DShowNET.IAMStreamConfig)
member.summary: Find media data by trial and error, just try every media type in the list, the ones that do not return an error, are accepted. This function might be handy if DShowNET is used as library instead of DirectShowLib. This function should be called with a derendered graph only, so with capture device only and no rendering of audio, video or VBI.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.DxUtils.VideoDecoderAvail
member.summary: Check if the Video Decoder interface is available

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.DxUtils.VideoStandard
member.summary: Gets and sets the video standard (NTSC, PAL, etc...) Added check on videoDecoder pointer, if value is null, then do nothing. An uninitialized pointer might be an error but might also indicate that the capture device does not support the Video Decoder interface (and that is not an error).

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.DxUtils.ColorSpaceEnum
member.remarks: Note to developers: when adding new color spaces enums ensure you add the associated Guids in the ColorSpace property.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.DxUtils.ColorSpaceEnum.HCW2
member.summary: HCW2 format for the Capture as well as the 656 pin Hauppauge PVR150 (I420 , IYUV??? 4:2:0 Intel Indeo)

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.Capture
member.summary: Use the Capture class to capture audio and video to AVI files.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.Capture.recFileMode
member.summary: Recording file mode (e.g. Windows Media Audio)

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.#ctor(DirectX.Capture.Filter,DirectX.Capture.Filter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new Capture object. videoDevice and audioDevice can be null if you do not wish to capture both audio and video. However at least one must be a valid device. Use the class to list available devices.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.Cue
member.summary: Prepare for capturing. Use this method when capturing must begin as quickly as possible.
member.remarks:
This will create/overwrite a zero byte file with the name set in the Filename property.
This will disable preview. Preview will resume once capture begins. This problem can be fixed if someone is willing to make the change.
This method is optional. If Cue() is not called, Start() will call it before capturing. This method cannot be called while capturing.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.Stop
member.summary: Stop the current capture capture. If there is no current capture, this method will succeed.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.Dispose
member.summary: Calls Stop, releases all references. If a capture is in progress it will be stopped, but the CaptureComplete event will NOT fire.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.createGraph
member.summary: Create a new filter graph and add filters (devices, compressors, misc), but leave the filters unconnected. Call renderGraph() to connect the filters.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.renderGraph
member.summary: Connects the filters of a previously created graph (created by createGraph()). Once rendered the graph is ready to be used. This method may also destroy streams if we have streams we no longer want.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.startPreviewIfNeeded
member.summary: Setup and start the preview window if the user has requested it (by setting PreviewWindow).

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.derenderGraph
member.summary: Disconnect and remove all filters except the device and compressor filters. This is the opposite of renderGraph(). Soem properties such as FrameRate can only be set when the device output pins are not connected.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.removeDownstream(DShowNET.IBaseFilter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes all filters downstream from a filter from the graph. This is called only by derenderGraph() to remove everything from the graph except the devices and compressors. The parameter "removeFirstFilter" is used to keep a compressor (that should be immediately downstream of the device) if one is begin used.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.destroyGraph
member.summary: Completely tear down a filter graph and release all associated resources.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.onPreviewWindowResize(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Resize the preview when the PreviewWindow is resized

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.getTempFilename
member.summary: Get a valid temporary filename (with path). We aren't using Path.GetTempFileName() because it creates a 0-byte file

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.getStreamConfigSetting(DShowNET.IAMStreamConfig,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the value of one member of the IAMStreamConfig format block. Helper function for several properties that expose video/audio settings from IAMStreamConfig.GetFormat(). IAMStreamConfig.GetFormat() returns a AMMediaType struct. AMMediaType.formatPtr points to a format block structure. This format block structure may be one of several types, the type being determined by AMMediaType.formatType.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.setStreamConfigSetting(DShowNET.IAMStreamConfig,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Set the value of one member of the IAMStreamConfig format block. Helper function for several properties that expose video/audio settings from IAMStreamConfig.GetFormat(). IAMStreamConfig.GetFormat() returns a AMMediaType struct. AMMediaType.formatPtr points to a format block structure. This format block structure may be one of several types, the type being determined by AMMediaType.formatType.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.assertStopped
member.summary: Assert that the class is in a Stopped state.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.Capture.useVMR9
member.summary: Use VMR9 flag, if false use the video renderer instead

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.Capture.allowSampleGrabber
member.summary: SampleGrabber flag, if false do not insert SampleGrabber in graph

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Capture.GrapImg
member.summary: Allocate memory space and set SetCallBack

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.Capture.previewStreamConfig
member.summary: IAMStreamConfig interface of preview pin. It is not really common that the preview has such interface, but if it has such interface it can be used "independent" from the capture pin interface.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.Capture.previewCaps
member.summary: Property Backer: preview capabilities of video device

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.Capture.dxUtils
member.summary: Interface to DirectShow utilities for controlling video

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.Capturing
member.summary: Is the class currently capturing. Read-only.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.Cued
member.summary: Has the class been cued to begin capturing. Read-only.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.Stopped
member.summary: Is the class currently stopped. Read-only.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.Filename
member.summary: Name of file to capture to. Initially set to a valid temporary file.
member.remarks:
If the file does not exist, it will be created. If it does exist, it will be overwritten. An overwritten file will not be shortened if the captured data is smaller than the original file. The file will be valid, it will just contain extra, unused, data after the audio/video data.
A future version of this class will provide a method to copy only the valid audio/video data to a new file.
This property cannot be changed while capturing or cued.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.PreviewWindow
member.summary: The control that will host the preview window.
member.remarks:
Setting this property will begin video preview immediately. Set this property after setting all other properties to avoid unnecessary changes to the internal filter graph (some properties like FrameSize require the internal filter graph to be stopped and disconnected before the property can be retrieved or set).
To stop video preview, set this property to null.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.VideoCaps
member.summary: The capabilities of the video device.
member.remarks:
It may be required to cue the capture (see ) before all capabilities are correctly reported. If you have such a device, the developer would be interested to hear from you.
The information contained in this property is retrieved and cached the first time this property is accessed. Future calls to this property use the cached results. This was done for performance.
However, this means you may get different results depending on when you access this property first. If you are experiencing problems, try accessing the property immediately after creating the Capture class or immediately after setting the video and audio compressors. Also, inform the developer.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.AudioCaps
member.summary: The capabilities of the audio device.
member.remarks:
It may be required to cue the capture (see ) before all capabilities are correctly reported. If you have such a device, the developer would be interested to hear from you.
The information contained in this property is retrieved and cached the first time this property is accessed. Future calls to this property use the cached results. This was done for performance.
However, this means you may get different results depending on when you access this property first. If you are experiencing problems, try accessing the property immediately after creating the Capture class or immediately after setting the video and audio compressors. Also, inform the developer.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.VideoDevice
member.summary: The video capture device filter. Read-only. To use a different device, dispose of the current Capture instance and create a new instance with the desired device.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.AudioDevice
member.summary: The audio capture device filter. Read-only. To use a different device, dispose of the current Capture instance and create a new instance with the desired device.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.VideoCompressor
member.summary: The video compression filter. When this property is changed the internal filter graph is rebuilt. This means that some properties will be reset. Set this property as early as possible to avoid losing changes. This property cannot be changed while capturing.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.AudioCompressor
member.remarks: When this property is changed the internal filter graph is rebuilt. This means that some properties will be reset. Set this property as early as possible to avoid losing changes. This property cannot be changed while capturing.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.VideoSource
member.summary: The current video source. Use Capture.VideoSources to list available sources. Set to null to disable all sources (mute).

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.AudioSource
member.summary: The current audio source. Use Capture.AudioSources to list available sources. Set to null to disable all sources (mute).

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.VideoSources
member.summary: Collection of available video sources/physical connectors on the current video device.
member.remarks:
In most cases, if the device has only one source, this collection will be empty.
The information contained in this property is retrieved and cached the first time this property is accessed. Future calls to this property use the cached results. This was done for performance.
However, this means you may get different results depending on when you access this property first. If you are experiencing problems, try accessing the property immediately after creating the Capture class or immediately after setting the video and audio compressors. Also, inform the developer.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.AudioSources
member.summary: Collection of available audio sources/physical connectors on the current audio device.
member.remarks:
In most cases, if the device has only one source, this collection will be empty. For audio there are 2 different methods for enumerating audio sources an audio crossbar (usually TV tuners?) or an audio mixer (usually sound cards?). This class will first look for an audio crossbar. If no sources or only one source is available on the crossbar, this class will then look for an audio mixer. This class does not support both methods.
The information contained in this property is retrieved and cached the first time this property is accessed. Future calls to this property use the cached results. This was done for performance.
However, this means you may get different results depending on when you access this property first. If you are experiencing problems, try accessing the property immediately after creating the Capture class or immediately after setting the video and audio compressors. Also, inform the developer.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.PropertyPages
member.remarks:
These are property pages exposed by the DirectShow filters. These property pages allow users modify settings on the filters directly.
The information contained in this property is retrieved and cached the first time this property is accessed. Future calls to this property use the cached results. This was done for performance.
However, this means you may get different results depending on when you access this property first. If you are experiencing problems, try accessing the property immediately after creating the Capture class or immediately after setting the video and audio compressors. Also, inform the developer.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.Tuner
member.summary: The TV Tuner or null if the current video device does not have a TV Tuner.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.FrameRate
member.summary: Gets and sets the frame rate used to capture video.
member.remarks:
Common frame rates: 24 fps for film, 25 for PAL, 29.997 for NTSC. Not all NTSC capture cards can capture at exactly 29.997 fps. Not all frame rates are supported. When changing the frame rate, the closest supported frame rate will be used.
Not all devices support getting/setting this property. If this property is not supported, accessing it will throw and exception.
This property cannot be changed while capturing. Changing this property while preview is enabled will cause some fickering while the internal filter graph is partially rebuilt. Changing this property while cued will cancel the cue. Call Cue() again to re-cue the capture.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.FrameSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the frame size used to capture video.
member.remarks:
To change the frame size, assign a new Size object to this property capture.Size = new Size( w, h ); rather than modifying the size in place (capture.Size.Width = w;). Not all frame rates are supported.
Not all devices support getting/setting this property. If this property is not supported, accessing it will throw and exception.
This property cannot be changed while capturing. Changing this property while preview is enabled will cause some fickering while the internal filter graph is partially rebuilt. Changing this property while cued will cancel the cue. Call Cue() again to re-cue the capture.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.AudioChannels
member.summary: Get or set the number of channels in the waveform-audio data.
member.remarks:
Monaural data uses one channel and stereo data uses two channels.
Not all devices support getting/setting this property. If this property is not supported, accessing it will throw and exception.
This property cannot be changed while capturing. Changing this property while preview is enabled will cause some fickering while the internal filter graph is partially rebuilt. Changing this property while cued will cancel the cue. Call Cue() again to re-cue the capture.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.AudioSamplingRate
member.summary: Get or set the number of audio samples taken per second.
member.remarks:
Common sampling rates are 8.0 kHz, 11.025 kHz, 22.05 kHz, and 44.1 kHz. Not all sampling rates are supported.
Not all devices support getting/setting this property. If this property is not supported, accessing it will throw and exception.
This property cannot be changed while capturing. Changing this property while preview is enabled will cause some fickering while the internal filter graph is partially rebuilt. Changing this property while cued will cancel the cue. Call Cue() again to re-cue the capture.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.AudioSampleSize
member.summary: Get or set the number of bits recorded per sample.
member.remarks:
Common sample sizes are 8 bit and 16 bit. Not all samples sizes are supported.
Not all devices support getting/setting this property. If this property is not supported, accessing it will throw and exception.
This property cannot be changed while capturing. Changing this property while preview is enabled will cause some fickering while the internal filter graph is partially rebuilt. Changing this property while cued will cancel the cue. Call Cue() again to re-cue the capture.

member.name: E:DirectX.Capture.Capture.CaptureComplete
member.summary: Fired when a capture is completed (manually or automatically).

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.AudioAvailable
member.summary: Check if there is an Audio Device

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.UseVMR9
member.summary: Check if VMR9 should be used

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.DeInterlace
member.summary: Store De-Interlace filter reference, is used upon adding de-interlace filter to graph

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.AllowSampleGrabber
member.summary: Check if usage SampleGrabber is allowed

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.PreviewFrameSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the frame size used to preview video.
member.remarks:
To change the frame size, assign a new Size object to this property capture.Size = new Size( w, h ); rather than modifying the size in place (capture.Size.Width = w;). Not all frame rates are supported.
Not all devices support getting/setting this property. If this property is not supported, accessing it will throw and exception.
The frame size used to capture video can be different than the frame size used in preview.
This property cannot be changed while capturing. Changing this property while preview is enabled will cause some fickering while the internal filter graph is partially rebuilt. Changing this property while cued will cancel the cue. Call Cue() again to re-cue the capture.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.ColorSpace
member.summary: Gets and sets the color space (and pixel format) used for capture.
member.remarks: Retrieving this propert will temporarily stop the preview. This property cannot be changed while capturing or cued.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.PreviewColorSpace
member.summary: Gets and sets the color space (and pixel format) used for preview.
member.remarks: Retrieving this propert will temporarily stop the preview. This property cannot be changed while capturing or cued.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Capture.PreviewCaps
member.summary: The preview capabilities of the video device.
member.remarks:
It may be required to cue the capture (see ) before all capabilities are correctly reported. If you have such a device, the developer would be interested to hear from you.
The information contained in this property is retrieved and cached the first time this property is accessed. Future calls to this property use the cached results. This was done for performance.
However, this means you may get different results depending on when you access this property first. If you are experiencing problems, try accessing the property immediately after creating the Capture class or immediately after setting the video and audio compressors. Also, inform the developer.

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.Capture.GraphState
member.summary: Possible states of the interal filter graph

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.Tuner
member.summary: Control and query a hardware TV Tuner.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Tuner.#ctor(DShowNET.IAMTVTuner)
member.summary: Initialize this object with a DirectShow tuner

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Tuner.SetFrequencyOverride(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,DShowNET.TunerInputType)
member.summary: Frequency Overrides are stored in the registry, in a key labeled TS[CountryCode]-[TunerInputType ], so for cable tv in Portugal it would be TS351-1

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.Tuner.ChannelAvailable(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if the tuner can tune to a particular channel.

remarks.para:
An automated scan to find available channels:
Use to determine the range of available channels.
For each channel, call ChannelAvailable. If this method returns false, do not display the channel to the user. If this method returns true, it will have found the exact frequency for the channel.
If ChannelAvailable is finding too many channels with just noise then check the property after calling ChannelAvailable. If SignalPresent is true, then the channel is most likely a valid, viewable channel. However this risks missing viewable channels with moderate noise. See for more information on locking on to a channel.
It is no longer required to perform a scan for each chanel's exact frequency. The tuner automatically finds the exact frequency each time the channel is changed.

This method correctly uses frequency-overrides. As described in the DirectX SDK topic "Collecting Fine-Tuning Information", this method does not use the IAMTVTuner.AutoTune() method. Instead it uses the suggested put_Channel() method.

member.returns: True if the channel's frequence was found, false otherwise.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Tuner.Channel
member.summary: Get or set the TV Tuner channel.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Tuner.InputType
member.summary: Get or set the tuner frequency (cable or antenna).

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Tuner.SignalPresent
member.summary: Indicates whether a signal is present on the current channel. If the signal strength cannot be determined, a NotSupportedException is thrown.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Tuner.TuningSpace
member.summary: set this to your country code. Frequency Overrides should be set to this code

members.member: Retrieves or sets the current mode on a multifunction tuner.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.Tuner.CountryCode
member.summary: Get or set the country code. Use the country code to set default frequency mappings.
member.remarks:
Below is a sample of available country codes:
1 - US
For a full list of country codes, see the DirectX 9.0 documentation topic "Country/Region Assignments"

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.AudioSource
member.summary: Represents a physical connector or source on an audio device. This class is used on filters that support the IAMAudioInputMixer interface such as source cards.

member.summary: Constructor. This class cannot be created directly.

member.summary: Retrieve the friendly name of a connectorType.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.AudioSource.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable this source. For audio sources it is usually possible to enable several sources. When setting Enabled=true, set Enabled=false on all other audio sources.

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.VfwCompressorPropertyPage
member.summary: The property page to configure a Video for Windows compliant compression codec. Most compressors support this property page rather than a DirectShow property page. Also, most compressors do not support the IAMVideoCompression interface so this property page is the only method to configure a compressor.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.VfwCompressorPropertyPage.vfwCompressDialogs
member.summary: Video for Windows compression dialog interface

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.VfwCompressorPropertyPage.Show(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Show the property page. Some property pages cannot be displayed while previewing and/or capturing.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.VfwCompressorPropertyPage.State
member.summary: Get or set the state of the property page. This is used to save and restore the user's choices without redisplaying the property page. This property will be null if unable to retrieve the property page's state.
member.remarks: After showing this property page, read and store the value of this property. At a later time, the user's choices can be reloaded by setting this property with the value stored earlier. Note that some property pages, after setting this property, will not reflect the new state. However, the filter will use the new settings.

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.VideoCapabilities
member.summary: Capabilities of the video device such as min/max frame size and frame rate.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.VideoCapabilities.InputSize
member.summary: Native size of the incoming video signal. This is the largest signal the filter can digitize with every pixel remaining unique. Read-only.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.VideoCapabilities.FrameSizeGranularityX
member.summary: Granularity of the output width. This value specifies the increments that are valid between MinFrameSize and MaxFrameSize. Read-only.

member.name: F:DirectX.Capture.VideoCapabilities.FrameSizeGranularityY
member.summary: Granularity of the output height. This value specifies the increments that are valid between MinFrameSize and MaxFrameSize. Read-only.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.VideoCapabilities.#ctor(DShowNET.IAMStreamConfig)
member.summary: Retrieve capabilities of a video device

member.name: T:DirectX.Capture.PropertyPageCollection
member.summary: A collection of available PropertyPages in a DirectShow filter graph. It is up to the driver manufacturer to implement a property pages on their drivers. The list of supported property pages will vary from driver to driver.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.PropertyPageCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize collection with no property pages.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.PropertyPageCollection.#ctor(DShowNET.ICaptureGraphBuilder2,DShowNET.IBaseFilter,DShowNET.IBaseFilter,DShowNET.IBaseFilter,DShowNET.IBaseFilter,DirectX.Capture.SourceCollection,DirectX.Capture.SourceCollection)
member.summary: Initialize collection with property pages from existing graph.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.PropertyPageCollection.addFromGraph(DShowNET.ICaptureGraphBuilder2,DShowNET.IBaseFilter,DShowNET.IBaseFilter,DShowNET.IBaseFilter,DShowNET.IBaseFilter,DirectX.Capture.SourceCollection,DirectX.Capture.SourceCollection)
member.summary: Populate the collection by looking for commonly implemented property pages.

member.name: M:DirectX.Capture.PropertyPageCollection.addIfSupported(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the object as an ISpecificPropertyPage if the object supports the ISpecificPropertyPage interface and has at least one property page.

member.name: P:DirectX.Capture.PropertyPageCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the filter at the specified index.
